Author: TiinyTunes
Text: In all honestly, it's probably water weight from being more active. I know that if I haven't worked out recently, then do some cardio or lift weights, my body holds on to water to repair itself from the activity. If I stay active consistently, or stop altogether, my weight goes back to business as usual. I have a fitbit, too, and I agree that it probably over exaggerates the calories burned, but yeah, anyway, probably just water and waste weight.
